edit because i cant delete for some reason and you just answered what i said

A taped adapter to jet engine size would be amazing.

It's already there.

The eighteenth page in less than 24 hours .... wow!

.

I guess "the incident" has forced the release of this mod somewhat prematurely. (I'm not complaining about that!).

.

The designs are absolutely stunning and fitting for KSP. The B9 pack was good, the B9 R2 is even better.

Thank you for sharing it with us (design illiterates).

It actually delayed the release and gave me time to make all MK2 stuff including the second IVA. So, yeah, you can thank the downtime for that stuff.

Whoops, no it's not.

Ah. Glad I pointed it out, then! Luckily it's an easy fix (On our end, anyway), as the Spaceport still has R1. Just downloaded that, yanked out the part file, voila.

Edit: Also, as I'm looking through this stuff and getting used to it, I've noticed a couple more things. The fuel tanks are under Structural, not Propulsion. If that's intentional, that's fine, but how do I change it? I'd prefer to keep all tanks together. And there's a great big MK4 adapter that references cargo holds, but I can't find anything else labeled MK4, and nothing else seems to be that big. Is this something designed for use with KW rocketry, or am I missing something?

Edited April 22, 2013 by loppnessmonsta

Gotta say these are absolutely my favorite pack of aerodynamic parts. KSP can only take so many parts loaded at once so I've replaced the stock airplane parts with yours as IMO they make awesome looking planes. Squad would be crazy not to hire you for these professional grade parts. Hopefully we'll be able to have them as stock parts sometime!

Ah. Glad I pointed it out, then! Luckily it's an easy fix (On our end, anyway), as the Spaceport still has R1. Just downloaded that, yanked out the part file, voila.

Edit: Also, as I'm looking through this stuff and getting used to it, I've noticed a couple more things. The fuel tanks are under Structural, not Propulsion. If that's intentional, that's fine, but how do I change it? I'd prefer to keep all tanks together. And there's a great big MK4 adapter that references cargo holds, but I can't find anything else labeled MK4, and nothing else seems to be that big. Is this something designed for use with KW rocketry, or am I missing something?

All fuselages are in structural tab and in a particular order for convenience, as I don't think it's good that you need to travel through multiple tabs and pages to get to a fuel tank after placing e.g. crew tank. Only parts that explicitly belong to other tabs, like engines, were placed in other tabs. When revamped part sorting system with tags or custom categories will arrive, I will come up with a better solution, but for now the current setup is the most convenient from my point of view.

You can change the place with "category" parameter in part.cfg. Write "catergory = propulsion", that should work.
Downloaded the pack 2 days ago,and i'm having tons of fun with it! Keep up the good work,i'm looking forward to new releases
I found that the control surfaces tend to work better if the range of movement is restricted to 5 degrees rather than 25. Just my 2-cents. Mechjeb flails a lot less.

Oh, Bac9, Could you make some probe-style versions of the cockpits? I have the feeling that if (iff) you could put a sort of cylon-like red sweeping light where the windows were, the pods would look cool, and fit with the rest of the pack. Again, just my 2-cents. I have about a quarter's worth, so I use it when I can.

Is it possible to get an extended version of the s2 crew module? Essentially what I mean is something like 3 or 4 of the existing unit, but fused as one? would help keep part cout low, and would use less struts. Also, I'm loving the 3.5m fuselages, but I'm trying to come up with a crew pod that fits in the cargo bay, with an extendable docking tube/clamp. Anyone got suggestions?

This is what happens when you give me shiny new parts. XD;

Its really an eye-catcher and one of the best part-packs for ksp

But i found some small error in it, the mk2 parts are not alligned with the basic mk2 parts (the connection point is a little bit to low)

This mod is the only reason I was reading the KSP forums at all. It's ludicrously good looking, probably the best bit of design ever seen in any mod for any game ever, so... thanks bac9!

what are you working on next?
Another incredible release, well done sir!

great looking pack,

would love to hear about what is next.

I find it shocking that nobody else has recognised the Arwing...

Youngings with their iPhones and PS3s... Back in my day we only had MarioKart and StarFox!

No but really, I still have StarFox 64 running on an emulator, which I play regularly.
can i please request more engines to go with this mod? also alowing surface attach would be nice, attaching engines can be a bit difficult at times
I really do love this pack, its brilliant. The only thing I'd love is adapters from each type of part for massive extra customisation, and some landing gear/legs to fit the style.
Beautiful parts, although I edited the category on the fuel-carrying ones so they're in with the fuel tanks. Can't wait to get home and build something epic with them!
